otsuge000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Sand boots for desert sands and
snow boots for...serious snowfall."<sp:5:1:0>
I've spared you the painful seal pun.
otsuge001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"If you seek the desert voe armor, you
must rise from the underground and find
the sealcret!" <sp:5:1:0>...Secret. She meant secret.
otsuge999:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Just what do these numbers mean?
I've been her attendant for a long time,
but even I am stumped by them...
<sp:3:0:2:0801>I can only assume that the brilliance
of those readings is simply beyond
our understanding...
talk0010:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><clr:0200><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad>Ugh, I can't stop myself from worrying about
the chief.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I wish this voe would go and check on her for me.


At least then I'd be able to rest a little easier...<clr:ffff><sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>We really appreciate you standing with us!
If your bows all break or you run out of
arrows, I can replace them!
otsuge002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"If you're finding the night extremely
cold, try wearing Rito armor. Enjoy the
seal-lestial...celestial bodies in the sky!"
talk0011:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><clr:0200><sp:3:0:2:0c00>Ugh, I can't stop myself from worrying about
the chief.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I wish this voe would go and check on Kara Kara
Bazaar.<sp:5:1:0> Then I'd at least be able to rest easier...<clr:ffff><sp:0:2:2:6400>
otsuge003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"A heroine statue sleeps beyond the
<clr:0000>Risoka Snowsealed<clr:ffff>...<sp:5:1:0><clr:0000>Risoka SnowFIELD<clr:ffff>."
talk0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Kara Kara Bazaar is the oasis near the
path into the desert.

On any normal day, you'd be able to
follow the road northeast straight out
of town and arrive there, but...
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><sp:0:2:2:5000>With this <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff>... I think the only ones who
could make it there right now would be the chief
or <clr:0000>Patricia<clr:ffff>.
Hmm...<sp:5:1:0> No, I think as long as I can see the <clr:0000>light of
the lighthouse<clr:ffff>, I'd be able to make it too.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
otsuge004:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Do not fear the sealkholes..." <sp:5:1:0>No, hold
on... <sp:5:1:0>"Do not fear the sinkholes! Vast
areas wait beneath them!"
otsuge005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Dragons aren't content with...<sp:5:1:0>sealface"?<sp:5:1:0>
Oh. Surface. "Dragons aren't content with
surface and sky alone!"
otsuge006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Splash-fruit prophecies seal...<sp:5:1:0>shall...<sp:5:1:0>
guide you to places worthy of your time!"
talk0000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The chief went to train in the
northern ruins.

She rode out there with her beloved
sand seal, <clr:0000>Patricia<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'm worried though. <sp:5:0:0>There have been a
lot of these strange monsters popping up
in the world lately.
But as worried as I am, this frustrating
<clr:0000>sand shroud <clr:ffff>makes it impossible to
navigate the desert.
The chief has an amazing sense of
direction, but I'm not so lucky.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>So instead of traveling aboveground,
I was thinking of using this secret passage
to get to the <clr:0000>northern ruins<clr:ffff>.
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>She's off with the chief right now.
I'd suggest checking <clr:0000>Kara Kara Bazaar<clr:ffff>.

If you want to speak with <clr:0000>Patricia<clr:ffff>, you'll
probably have to wait until things have
settled down and the chief isn't so busy.
talk0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This is the chief's beloved sand
seal, <clr:0000>Patricia<clr:ffff>!

She is no ordinary sand seal though.
Patricia is actually something of
an oracle!
Please, offer her some fruit.<sp:5:0:0> In return,
she'll share a reading with you!

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Though if you give her <clr:0000>splash fruit<clr:ffff>,
you'll almost certainly get a strange,
number-filled reading.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I can only assume that the brilliance
of those readings is simply beyond
our understanding...
talk0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>She's off with the chief right now. They
headed out to the <clr:0000>northern ruins<clr:ffff>.

If you want to speak with <clr:0000>Patricia<clr:ffff>, you'll
probably have to wait until things have
settled down and the chief isn't so busy.
talk0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Please, offer <clr:0000>Patricia<clr:ffff> some <clr:0000>fruit<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:0:0> In return,
she'll share a reading with you!

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Though if you give her <clr:0000>splash fruit<clr:ffff>,
you'll almost certainly get a strange,
number-filled reading.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I can only assume that the brilliance
of those readings is simply beyond
our understanding...
talk0018:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The reading that Patricia previously
shared with you was...
talk0004:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>I hope the chief is OK... Maybe I should go after
her? But I'm just the attendant to <clr:0000>Patricia<clr:ffff>.

I would be acting against her wishes too...


If I were to go, though, I could just go through here.
It comes out at the <clr:0000>northern ruins<clr:ffff>, and that's where
the chief was headed...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Patricia is the chief's beloved sand seal.


You've heard of sand seals, right?
They're desert creatures that can navigate
the dunes with amazing ease!
And Patricia is a very special one. She
seemingly has the <clr:0000>power of an oracle<clr:ffff>!

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Or, she did. Ever since the Upheaval,
she's mostly just been sharing these
<clr:0000>strange numbers<clr:ffff>...
I've been her attendant for years now,
but even I can't make sense of this turn
of events.
talk0007:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>The chief received a report earlier that
<clr:0000>Kara Kara Bazaar<clr:ffff>'s in trouble, and it caused the
color to drain out of her face...
I hope the chief and <clr:0000>Patricia<clr:ffff> are both OK...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0009:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>Those strange monsters are still lurking out there...<sp:5:1:0>
Tsk,<sp:5:1:0> I should've insisted on coming with her,
dangerous or not.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk40:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice>Hmm. Looks like you've run out of arrows.
<sp:5:0:0>Here, these should help!
talk41:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_00>Ah. Yes, I gathered up some weapons and
the materials to improve them. There's
also some food...<sp:5:0:0>oh, and some rupees.
Some of the troops found these strange
capsules while patrolling, so those are
here too.
And of course,<sp:5:0:0> if things get really dire...<sp:0:4:0>Like, <sp:5:0:0>say, <sp:5:0:0>if your bows all break or you run
out of arrows <clr:0000>in the middle of the battle<clr:ffff>,
I can help you there too.
talk42:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Understood. <sp:5:0:0>If you need something,
please come see me.
talk43: <sp:3:0:2:0701>Is there anything else I can help you with?
talk44:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There are three gates... <sp:5:0:0>From the palace,
the north gate is ahead, the west gate is
left, and the east gate is right.
I've got an idea for a barricade... I'll use
iron barrels and wood to block the path.

Which gate should I set it up at?
talk30:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>OK, the barricade has been set up at the
<clr:0000>east gate<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:0:0> That should slow down any
enemies that attack that position.
talk45:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Understood. I'll leave things as they are
for now.

Is there anything else I can help with?
talk31:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>OK, the barricade has been set up at the
<clr:0000>west gate<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:0:0> That should slow down any
enemies that attack that position.
talk46:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Notice>That's the same gate where the spear
troops with electric weapons are, isn't it?

<sp:3:0:2:0800>I'd expect some synergy between those
electric attacks and the iron barrels of
the barricade!
talk47:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm happy to help you with materials or by
setting up a barricade. Just let me know.
talk32:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>OK, the barricade has been taken down.<sp:5:0:0>
Come find me if you want it put up at one
of the gates.
talk48:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Did you think you could sneak in without
being noticed? You Yiga coward...

Leave at once or I'll have you begging
for mercy.
talk34:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice>It looks like you're lacking a bow of any
kind. <sp:5:0:0>Here, use this!
talk35:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice>And it looks like you've run out of arrows.
<sp:5:0:0>Here, these should help!
talk20:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>You handled yourself well in the battle.
It was quite a sight to see!

You've absolutely earned your share of
the spoils. Help yourself!
otsuge900:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Patricia, as always, offers guiding words
of wisdom!
talk38:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I've been gathering materials that I think
might be useful in battle. Feel free to take
anything you need from here!
Also, I'm confident that I can build a
barricade at any of the gates.

Would that help you?
talk39:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>If your bows all break or you run out of
arrows, I can replace them!
talk26:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I built the barricade at the <clr:0000>north gate<clr:ffff>, but
I can move it if you want it somewhere
else. Should I move it to another gate?
talk27:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I built the barricade at the <clr:0000>west gate<clr:ffff>, but
I can move it if you want it somewhere
else. Should I move it to another gate?
talk28:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I built the barricade at the <clr:0000>east gate<clr:ffff>, but
I can move it if you want it somewhere
else. Should I move it to another gate?
talk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Gibdo parts are often used to improve
weapons. The only real downside to them
is their own brittle nature...
talk29:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>OK, the barricade has been set up at the
<clr:0000>north gate<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:0:0> That should slow down any
enemies that attack that position.
